Articles.Content: I found KSP when i was watch orbiter video.Then i download the demo.

I was looking through Wikipedia's list of game engines, mostly just to see if there were any good FOSS ones, and I came across Unity. Then looked at the examples of games made using it, there was KSP and so I looked it up and made a mental note to look further into it when I'd finished University for the year, which I did.
Kurtjmac's Let's plays, I tried the demo, got hooked and bought it
I watched a clip OfficialNerdCubed on youtube posted, I was like O_O the whole video.
Someone posted a thread in a forum of a gaming-clan I am part of. I looked briefly but thought noting of it. Later I took a deeper look in to it, downloaded the demo. And now I am stuck here.

I found KSP last week through reading the Bungie Mailsack responses. They talked about playing KSP and I looked it up. I liked the video, downloaded the demo. Liked the demo, bought the game. Now I can't stop playing!!

Or, since I'm at work....stop thinking about playing it!!
My neighbor's friend told me about KSP. Best 15 dollars I ever spent.
I found about this earlier this week while chatting on IRC. One of the regulars brought it up, so I looked it up. Hooked hard ever since.
Stumbleupon, I think right after the first release.
Saw some kind of Youtube vid and then came to the site.

I was following Notch's space game 0x10c. Game is a long way from even a pre-alpha build, but on 0x10cforum.com Someone was posting about 'other space-y games to play while you wait'.

Kerbal Space Program was mentioned, demo'ed it, and bought it the same day. I think it was .12 at the time.

I was watching NerdÃ‚Â³-Let's Plays when he introduced KSP. I was like: :-O "gimme,gimme,gimme!!!"

And then I was satified. And now I see the features of 0.17 and I am like: :-O "gimme,gimme,gimme!!!"

xD

I found about about in on the space reddit but wasn't intrested then, Got Orbiter 2010 instead when I saw that, got bored of it and tried out the Kerbal Space Program demo. Absolutely loved it and brought it a few days later.

I only brought it a few days ago so the gap was quite a while between Orbiter 2010 and trying out KSP.
